intro: Humiria densiflora, commonly known as the dense-flowered humiria, is a herbaceous plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Arecaceae, which includes palms, although it is not a true palm. The plant is characterized by its dense clusters of small, white flowers that bloom in the axils of its leaves. Humiria densiflora typically grows in wet, swampy areas and is adapted to high humidity and waterlogged soil. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
